title: Stanley Williams
summary: Stanley Tookie Williams III[1] (December 29, 1953 â€“ December 13, 2005) was an American gang member who co-founded and led the Crips gang in Los Angeles. He and Raymond Washington formed an alliance in 1971 that established the Crips as Los Angeles' first major African-American street gang. During the 1970s, Williams was the de facto leader of the Crips and the prominent crime boss in South Central Los Angeles.[2]
